As an AI language model, I do not have emotional responses, personal opinions or feelings, but here are some general tips on how to deal with negative feedback or criticism on social media:

1. Take a step back: When you receive negative feedback or criticism, it can be easy to get defensive or upset. Take a step back and give yourself some time to cool off before responding. 2. Respond with professionalism: When you do respond, keep your tone professional and avoid getting defensive or aggressive. Acknowledge the feedback, and try to see if there is any constructive criticism that you can take away from it. 3. Ignore trolls: Sometimes, people online will leave negative comments just to get a reaction out of you. Learn to recognize when someone is being deliberately hurtful or abusive and ignore them. 4. Don't take it personally: Remember, criticism of your artwork is not a personal attack on you as a person. Try not to take it personally, and focus on using the feedback to improve your work. 5. Seek support: Creating art can be a vulnerable process, and negative feedback can be demotivating. Seek support from friends, family, or an online community of artists who can offer encouragement and constructive criticism. Remember that criticism can help you improve your work and push you to be a better artist. Don't let negative feedback discourage you from pursuing your passion.
